Back in November, Sony started selling PS5 consoles [at a $100 discount](https://www.engadget.com/deals/cyber-monday-ps5-deals-are-still-available-get-100-off-consoles-plus-discounts-on-playstation-games-accessories-and-more-164015817.html?guccounter=1) as part of a Black Friday/Cyber Monday promotion. The deal officially sunsets at 3AM ET, so now is a good time to bite the bullet on a gaming console given that prices aren't likely [to go down anytime soon](https://tech.yahoo.com/gaming/articles/hardware-prices-not-fall-industry-203403984.html).

You can pick up a [regular disc-based PS5 for $450](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=66ea567a-c987-4c2e-a2ff-02904efde6ea&itemId=amazon_B0FRGTYSL5&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=a6eba115-9a6b-4ac9-bf33-623b739bc112&featureId=text-link&merchantName=Amazon&linkText=regular+disc-based+PS5+for+%24450&custData=eyJzb3VyY2VOYW1lIjoiV2ViLURlc2t0b3AtVmVyaXpvbiIsImxhbmRpbmdVcmwiOiJodHRwczovL3d3dy5hbWF6b24uY29tL1BsYXlTdGF0aW9uJTI1MjVDMiUyNTI1QUU1LWNvbnNvbGUtMVRCLVBsYXlTdGF0aW9uLTUvZHAvQjBGUkdUWVNMNS8_&signature=AQAAAW9SneG0ssArUU3NMWrVMRSkWuFPzgiGlzbuIYnzD3VQ&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2FPlayStation%2525C2%2525AE5-console-1TB-PlayStation-5%2Fdp%2FB0FRGTYSL5%2F) and a [digital model for $400](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=66ea567a-c987-4c2e-a2ff-02904efde6ea&itemId=amazon_B0FRGMYJMG&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=a6eba115-9a6b-4ac9-bf33-623b739bc112&featureId=text-link&merchantName=Amazon&linkText=digital+model+for+%24400&&signature=AQAAAasQzXJ-Es1FHvharcQWJzryz-_dVjVs7rrA9rpipeTS&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2FPlayStation%2525C2%2525AE5-console-1TB-PlayStation-5%2Fdp%2FB0FRGMYJMG). The beefy PS5 Pro [is available for $650](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=66ea567a-c987-4c2e-a2ff-02904efde6ea&itemId=amazon_B0DGY63Z2H&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=a6eba115-9a6b-4ac9-bf33-623b739bc112&featureId=text-link&merchantName=Amazon&linkText=is+available+for+%24650&custData=eyJzb3VyY2VOYW1lIjoiV2ViLURlc2t0b3AtVmVyaXpvbiIsImxhbmRpbmdVcmwiOiJodHRwczovL3d3dy5hbWF6b24uY29tL1BsYXlTdGF0aW9uJTI1MjVDMiUyNTI1QUU1LWNvbnNvbGUtMVRCLVBsYXlTdGF0aW9uLTUvZHAvQjBER1k2M1oySC8_&signature=AQAAAZb4nlTb2d1IiaZ7_SvxH-ie2MQVaSzOChKGqY3D-CbN&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2FPlayStation%2525C2%2525AE5-console-1TB-PlayStation-5%2Fdp%2FB0DGY63Z2H%2F). All of these deals are active on Amazon, but also [directly from Sony](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=a6eba115-9a6b-4ac9-bf33-623b739bc112&featureId=text-link&linkText=directly+from+Sony&&signature=AQAAAVjlnnhXHDRXdn-sGHzMhcZTDAoVlBBjvQZYYQwsxZYB&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fdirect.playstation.com%2Fen-us%2Fhardware%2Fps5).

If the costs here still sound a bit high, that's because Sony [raised console prices by $50](https://www.engadget.com/gaming/playstation/sony-raises-ps5-console-prices-in-the-us-153429564.html) back in August. In other words, these $100 discounts are pretty much $50 discounts when factoring in that recent increase. Still, cheaper is cheaper. This puts the digital PS5 at the same price as an Xbox Series S and the disc-based version at the same price as a Switch 2.

Both standard PS5 configurations won't arrive until December 28. The PS5 Pro, however, is available for same-day shipping if you're jonesing for one last holiday gift.

The PS5 has a fairly large stable of exclusive titles made by Sony-owned studios. These include games like _Horizon Forbidden West_, _Astro Bot_, _Death Stranding 2_ and _Ghost of Yotei_.
